Title: Brunei’s Lumut LNG yet to resume shipments despite its loading restart after a compressor-led outage
Description: The 7.2 mtpa Brunei LNG export plant in Lumut has loaded its first cargo after a 12-day hiatus  due to an outage at its onshore gas compressor plants on May 20. However, it has yet to export any cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: EU LNG imports dip in May to their lowest since September 2023
Description: Imports of LNG into the 27 European Union countries fell back in May after rebounding in April on exporters favouring Asia as a destination for LNG over Europe.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies signs LNG supply agreements with India’s IOCL, Korea South-East Power
Description: France’s TotalEnergies signed two short- and long-term LNG supply agreements with two firms in Asia, which it said was in line with its strategy to grow its LNG business.
Author: JS

Title: EU is “not too reliant on the US” for LNG; looks to more gas supplies from Azerbaijan
Description: The European Union’s imports of US LNG have climbed to their highest levels in two years, making it the largest LNG supplier to the region since Russia curtailed pipeline gas deliveries to the region after its invasion of Ukraine in 2022. But the bloc’s Energy Commissioner Kadri Simson says it hasn’t swapped its dependence on Russian pipeline gas for US LNG.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron’s Gorgon LNG plant resumes production after “minor fault”
Description: The Chevron-operated 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant in Western Australia has resumed production following an outage caused by a “minor fault.”
Author: CK

Title: EU seeks more partners for early warning gas supply security system
Description: The European Union is hoping to attract the participation of LNG-producing and consuming countries in an early warning gas mechanism it started together with Japan last year, as it continues to promote the need for continued preparedness in ensuring energy supply security amid various geopolitical tensions and Russia’s continued war with Ukraine.
Author: CK
